member.name: T:YourLastOptionsDialog.Common.BooleanToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Converts a boolean value to a visibiliy value. The converter parameter allows inversion of the behavior, i.e.: value == true AND parameter == false => Visibility.Visible value == true AND parameter == true => Visibility.Collapsed value == false AND parameter == false => Visibility.Collapsed value == false AND parameter == true => Visibility.Visible

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.Common.BooleanToVisibilityConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Modifies the source data before passing it to the target for display in the UI.
member.param: The source data being passed to the target.
The of data expected by the target dependency property.
An optional parameter to be used in the converter logic.
The culture of the conversion.
member.returns: The value to be passed to the target dependency property.

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.Common.BooleanToVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Modifies the target data before passing it to the source object. This method is called only in bindings.
member.param: The target data being passed to the source.
The of data expected by the source object.
An optional parameter to be used in the converter logic.
The culture of the conversion.
member.returns: The value to be passed to the source object.

member.name: T:YourLastOptionsDialog.Attributes.OptionEnumAttribute
member.summary: An option attribute that represents an enumeration option.

member.name: T:YourLastOptionsDialog.Attributes.OptionAttribute
member.summary: An attribute used to decorate properties of arbitrary classes to configure their treatment as options.

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.Attributes.OptionAttribute.Format(System.String)
member.summary: Formats the specified property value, either by returning a localized resource for the given value, or by returning the value itself if no localized resources have been configured.
member.param: The property value that may or may not be a resource key.

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.Attributes.OptionAttribute.GetPropertyAccessor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an accessor to the actual value of any property of the option attribute. This works as follows: if the user has defined a , this method reflects on the resource to get an accessor that can be used to fetch the actual value. If no has been configured or the property value could not be found in the resources as key, the returned accessor passes through the property value itself.
member.param: The property value that also is a potential key in a resource class if the has been configured.
member.returns: An accessor that returns either the value from a resource class, or simply the unchanged property value for the given property.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.Attributes.OptionBooleanAttribute.ActivationPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets the activation prompt. This is only used if is set to true. If a is set in the base class, this should contain the key to the localized entry in the resources.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.Attributes.OptionBooleanAttribute.DeactivationPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets the deactivation prompt. This is only used if is set to true. If a is set in the base class, this should contain the key to the localized entry in the resources.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the wrapped underlying source.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.ViewModels.Options.StringOption.MinLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowed length of the value. This is used for validation if no custom validator has been configured. The default value is zero.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.ViewModels.Options.StringOption.MaxLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed length of the value. This is used for validation if no custom validator has been configured. The default value is .

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.ViewModels.Options.StringOption.InputScopeNameValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the input scope name value that is used to create the to display a suitable SIP keyboard layout to the user.

member.summary: Gets the input scope used to display a suitable SIP keyboard layout to the user. This value is determined by the value of the property.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.ViewModels.Options.StringOption.RegularExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets a regular expression that is used to validate the string entered by the user.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.ViewModels.Options.StringOption.ValidationErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation error message that is used if the value is outside the configured minimum or maximum length, or if the value does not satisfy the given regular expression.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.ViewModels.Options.StringOption.Validator
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of validator to use for validation. If a validator is specified, then none of the other validation properties are in effect anymore. In particular, if a validator is configured, the values of , , and are ignored and the validator is instead used for all validation.

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.Controls.ValidatingTextBox.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call . In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in an application. For more information, see Remarks.

member.summary: Called before event occurs.

member.summary: Gets or sets the validator used for validation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the validation error message that is displayed when the validation fails.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.Controls.ValidatingTextBox.ValidationErrorMessageVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation error message visibility that determines whether the text box should show its own validation error message. If a user of the text box wants to display their own validation error, this can be set to to suppress the display of the validation message.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.Controls.ValidatingTextBox.ActualValidationErrorMessageVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual validation error message visibility. The value of this property depends on whether the current state of the content is valid or not, and whether the text box is allowed to display its own validation error message or not.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.Controls.ValidatingTextBox.IsValid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value of the text box is valid or not.
member.value: true if the value is valid; otherwise, false.

member.summary: The singleton instance of the .

member.summary: Shows the options page using the given values and configuration.
member.param: The values the options are generated from.
The configuration with additional parameters for the .

member.summary: Shows the options page using the given values.
member.param: The values the options are generated from.

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.OptionsService.RestoreAfterTombstoning(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores the state of the option page after a real tombstoning situation. Users of the are supposed to pass in a reference to the restored values object after tombstoning. If no updated reference is provided, the options page initiates a back navigation when it returns from tombstoning. Note: If the and/or properties are used, users of the are also required to restore these after tombstoning.
member.param: The values that are restored.

member.name: M:YourLastOptionsDialog.OptionsService.RestoreAfterTombstoning(System.Object,YourLastOptionsDialog.OptionsConfiguration)
member.summary: Restores the state of the option page after a real tombstoning situation. Users of the are supposed to pass in a reference to the restored values object after tombstoning. If no updated reference is provided, the options page initiates a back navigation when it returns from tombstoning. Note: If the and/or properties are used, users of the are also required to restore these after tombstoning.
member.param: The values that are restored.
The configuration with additional parameters for the that are restored.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.OptionsService.Configuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the current configuration of the .

member.summary: Gets or sets the arbitrary object used to generate the options.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.OptionsService.OptionsViewFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the options view factory that is used to create UI editors for the options. By default this uses an instance of the , which can be overriden by own implementations or classes derived from the default implementation, to provide custom views for certain option types.

member.name: P:YourLastOptionsDialog.OptionsService.OptionsFactoryExtender
member.summary: Gets or sets the options factory extender. This can be set to add support for additional property types, or to change the behavior of the options service for existing types. If an extender is added for new types, it's also required to provide an that serves view implementations for these types. By default, no extender is used, unless the YourLastOptionsDialog.Extras project is used.
